results.title: The Hands
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and John Barnes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
This pantomime, performed by Marcel Marceau is an allegory of good and evil. The struggle between them is revealed by the force of the hands through symbolic movements. Assisted by Pierre Verry. Introduced by Marcel Marceau. Music by the Russian Cathedral Orthodox Choir, Paris.

results.title: The Handmaid's tale
results.creator_credit: Cinecom Entertainment Group, Daniel Wilson and Volker Schlondorff
results.brief_description: In the near future, the air and water is poisoned, the result is sterility. Only one out of a hundred women can still bear children and some women stopped, believing there would be no future. The solution; to create an army of ‘handmaids’, an involuntary, semi-religious order of women who exist solely to bear children for the rich, powerful ruling class. Kate (Natasha Richardson) becomes a victim of this cruel and backward world, where women are divided into three kinds, Handmaids, Wives or Prostitutes. A chilling look at a possible future. Based on the novel by Margaret Atwood. Screenplay by Harold Pinter. Cast also includes Victoria Tennant, Faye Dunaway, Elizabeth McGovern, Aidan Quinn and Robert Duvall.

results.title: The Hand that rocks the cradle
results.creator_credit: Master Tele Films and Roy Darling
results.brief_description: A family friend, a journalist, attends a family dinner with his fiancee. A strong clear message emerges that wars could be avoided if women ruled the world.

results.title: The Hand of Stalin
results.creator_credit: October Films, British Broadcasting Corporation, Tom Roberts and John Walker
results.brief_description: A three part series examining the history of Stalinism in the former Soviet UnioN focusing on oral histories of people who lived through the turbulent and totalitarian Communist regime of the late 1930s. As they relive memories of collectivisation, the purges and the Gulags, the series becomes an almost unbearable testament to the brutality of power. However, by talking to peasants, intellectuals, former KGB and dissenters, the series avoids histrionics and controversy and allows the dignity of people’s voices to tell their own stories.

results.title: The Hand of death = Shaolin men
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Raymond Chow and John Woo
results.brief_description: John Woo wrote and directed this action film starring Jackie Chan, Samo Hung, Dorian Tan and James Tien. Following the breakup of their group after an invasion from the rival Manchus, 8 Shaolin renegades form their own resistance group. They train under their old leader, until he deems them ready enough to challenge the Manchus and save the Chung Dynasty. Poorly dubbed into English.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SOUND]
results.creator_credit: W H Productions, Mack Sennett Comedies, Mack Sennett and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: A burlesque of the famous poem by Hugh Antoine D’Arcy of the broken-down artist who, having lost his wife to another man, draws her face on the floor and then passes out, drunk. Sound version with piano accompaniament.

results.title: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]
results.creator_credit: Keystone Film Company, Mack Sennett Comedies, Mack Sennett and Charles Chaplin
results.brief_description: The plot is a satire derived from Hugh Antoine D’Arcy’s poem “The Face on the bar room floor. It tells of the broken-down artist (Charlie Chaplin) who, having lost his wife (Cecile Arnold) to another man, draws her face on the floor of a bar room. Charlie tells his tragic story in flashbacks. NB: Silent film with no soundtrack.
results.title_for_label: The Ham artist = The Face on the bar room floor [SILENT]

results.title: The Half-masted schooner
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and Bruce Mackay
results.brief_description: A film combining a tuneful ballad with an equally engaging kaleidoscope of pictures, some relating to the story of the song and some not, but all most cheering and amusing to the eye. The soft focus of the live photography and the pleasing patterns of abstract designs combine with the relaxed mood of the ballad to produce an agreeable interlude of sights and sounds. Spawned from the hippy experimental culture of the time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and Bruce Mackay

results.title: The Hairy bird
results.creator_credit: Alliance Communications, Redeemable Features, Ira Deutchman, Peter Newman and Sarah Kernochan
results.brief_description: A fun romp set in 1960s middle-class white America, in a private girls’ school that is set to become co-educational. Odette is a new student and finds herself a fish-out-of-water until she embraces her new roommates and friends learning of the girls’ secret society - the D.A.R. (Daughters of American Ravioli) a reference to the cans of cold pasta they pilfer from the school kitchens via their secret attic dwelling. The girls go about ruining the imposed decision that they merge with the boys at St Ambrose by sabotaging the school dance and becoming politically active, much to the pleasure of the strict but approachable headmistress (Lynn Redgrave). At Miss Godard’s School for Girls this coming-of-age tale is full of sass and toe-tapping fun. Written and directed by Sarah Kernochan. Cast includes: Kirsten Dunst, Gaby Hoffman, Rachel Leigh Cook, Vincent Kartheiser, Monica Keena, Heather Matarazzo, and Merritt Wever.
